939526347730407424.text:
Bitcoin: my answer to the repeated questions.
No, there is NO way to properly short the bitcoin "bubble". Any strategy that doesn't entail options is nonergodic (subjected to blowup). Just as one couldn't rule out 5K, then 10K, one can't rule out 100K.
Gabish?

This particular type of rhetoric from @vinarmani 10 days ago, characterizing the upcoming BCH #HashWar as a battle for the soul of crypto - an appropriate label for it would seem to be #cryptopsychomachy

1062954461478285312.text:
5/ #cryptologomachy pervades. Which #Bitcoin is legit? #BTC & #BCH (& how many other minor variants?) battle it out.

Same for ABC v SV versions of BCH, battling in a #HashWar.

Similar to classic #Ethereum disputes over ETH v ETC.

Or #Shasper v #Serenity names for Ethereum 2.0.

1062932783117492224.text:
4/ So today, we don’t just have a #HashWar, we also have widespread #cryptologomachy

From Greek, that’s

kryptós: hidden

lógos: a word, saying, speech, discourse, thought, proportion, ratio, reckoning

-machia: equivalent to mách(ē) battle

1062930024129429505.text:
3/ And thus from the term #logomachy, I hereby coin #cryptologomachy - which means *arguing about crypto words*!

Like @jwolpert’s term #statefulinternet, its ramification may start slowly, but with some persistence, we can make it a thing!

(or maybe it’s #cryptofetch )pic.twitter.com/lEoySOOsaS

1062917556489469954.text: 2/ Arguing over meaning, usage and ownership of terms, like #Crypto itself, is slightly different. People aren’t “over it”, instead they signal that their tribe is the “rightful” owner. Witness silly #Cryptography v #Cryptocurrency fights (v #Cryptoasset v #Cryptocommodity, etc.)

975854914671988739.text:
In the 1970s, Saltzer & Schroeder published security design principles including “Economy of Mechanism”. (i.e. Keep the design as simple and small as possible, which is still good advice.)

In the 2010s, blockchain-based cryptocurrency has become the Mechanism of Economies.

970880945245966336.text:
While we’ve all likely met a “block punk” or two on crypto-Twitter, Blockpunk is a distinct new sci-fi genre for the blockchain age. 

The article referenced below includes how it specifically differs from Cyberpunk that @GreatDismal helped solidify 24 years ago with Neuromancer.https://twitter.com/cellarius2084/status/970735993316937728 …
